events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred on April 9th, involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorised as an Auto Accident due to keywords indicating vehicle collision in the initial report.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the car accident claim and to guide the customer through the settlement process.
The claim has been officially acknowledged by the insurance company, confirming receipt and initiation of the process.
The customer was requested to submit the police report, photos of vehicle damage, and a copy of the driving license for further review.
The customer provided all requested documents including accident photos and police report within the specified timeframe.
An internal investigation was initiated to verify the circumstances and damages related to the vehicle collision claim.
The investigation was completed confirming the accident details and assessing the repair costs for the damaged vehicle.
The insurance company proposed a settlement amount based on repair estimates and policy coverage for the auto accident claim.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the speed and clarity of communication.
The claim was formally approved by the claims department after the customer accepted the settlement proposal.
The settlement payment was issued to the customer's account promptly following approval of the auto accident claim.
The claim was officially closed after payment confirmation, and all related documentation was archived internally.
All claim documents and correspondence related to the vehicle collision have been securely archived for future reference.
